screen_desc: This screenshot displays the "Notifications" settings on an Android phone. It shows a list of recently sent notifications from apps like Clock, Maps, and Google Play Store, each with a toggle to enable or disable alerts. At the top, there is an icon for managing notification settings and silent mode. The screen also provides an option to view all notifications from the last 7 days and has settings for lock screen notifications.
action_think: According to the user's request, they want to toggle the setting for showing notifications on the lock screen. The 'Notifications on lockscreen' option is visible on the current screenshot at the bottom, with a toggle switch next to it that can be turned on or off. There is no need for additional actions beyond toggling this switch to fulfill the user request.
action_desc: Click on the toggle switch next to 'Notifications on lockscreen'.
action_result:
By scrolling up, the user has revealed additional options in the "Notifications" settings, such as "Notifications on lockscreen" and the "Advanced" section. This is an important step because it brings the relevant toggle for "Notifications on lockscreen" into view, which is necessary for completing the user request to enable or disable notifications on the lock screen. 

This action has made progress toward the user request, as the user can now interact with the "Notifications on lockscreen" toggle to make the desired change.
